p: The ONNV fever acute phase follows an eight-day or more incubation period [ 122]. It is characterized by the triad of fever, polyarthralgia, and lymphadenopathy. This last sign is more specific to ONNV infection and is mostly located in the cervical region. Skin rash is associated a few days later and is often itchy. Other reported complications include headaches, gastrointestinal symptoms, and eye involvement [ 44, 122, 141]. Bleeding gums and epistaxis have been reported for one patient each [ 141]. To our knowledge, no mortality linked to ONNV infection has been described.
